skill.name: add-dependency
skill.description: Add a new third-party dependency to the project following the version catalog and approval workflow.
skill.summary: Add a new third-party dependency to the project following the version catalog and approval workflow.
skill.author: AnySoftKeyboard

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill describing a dependency management workflow. No executable code is present. References to build scripts and file operations are informational, not functional. Safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Adding dependencies manually can lead to version conflicts and hardcoded values. This skill provides a structured workflow to add third-party dependencies using version catalogs while requiring user approval for safety.
actual_capabilities: Verify dependency necessity and consider alternatives
Search for latest stable library versions online
Add dependencies to Gradle version catalog (libs.versions.toml)
Ensure version numbers are centralized, not hardcoded
Run build verification after adding dependencies
Obtain user approval before making changes
limitations: Does not automatically modify files without user approval
Does not resolve version conflicts between existing dependencies
Does not detect transitive dependency issues
Requires user confirmation for each dependency addition

use_cases.title: Add Android libraries safely

use_cases.title: Maintain version catalogs
use_cases.description: Keep dependencies organized in libs.versions.toml with consistent formatting

use_cases.title: Standardize dependency workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure team follows approval process for new third-party code

best_practices: Always get user approval before adding new third-party dependencies
Use version catalogs (libs.versions.toml) instead of hardcoding versions
Search for latest stable versions before adding dependencies
Run a build after adding dependencies to verify they resolve correctly
anti_patterns: Hardcoding version numbers directly in build.gradle.kts files
Adding dependencies without checking for alternatives or necessity
Skipping the build verification step after dependency changes
Modifying files without user approval in non-autonomous mode

faq.question: What is a version catalog?
faq.answer: A version catalog (libs.versions.toml) centralizes dependency management, making it easy to update versions across the project.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files automatically?
faq.answer: No, the skill requires user approval before making any changes to build configuration files.

faq.question: What build systems are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports Gradle-based projects using version catalogs, including Android and Java/Kotlin applications.

faq.question: Is my build data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only reads and modifies dependency configuration files following an approval workflow.

faq.question: What if the build fails after adding a dependency?
faq.answer: The skill recommends running a build verification. If it fails, you can remove the dependency or troubleshoot compatibility issues.

faq.question: How is this different from manual dependency management?
faq.answer: This skill enforces best practices like using version catalogs, requiring approval, and verifying builds automatically.
